description: Sri Lanka, which attended the just concluded Belt and Road Forum here, has backed India's concern over the Kashmir issue, saying it is difficult for New Delhi to accept the $50 billion China-Pakistan Economic Corridor (CPEC) as it goes through the "heart of Indian interests".
title: Sri Lanka backs India's concerns over China's OBOR project - Times of India

author: Andrew Fidel Fernando
description: Sri Lanka coach Graham Ford has identified batting as Sri Lanka's foremost strength and said flat tracks would give the team the best chance to put the opposition under pressure
title: Ford hopes for flat batting tracks in England

author: Meera Srinivasan
description: He asks Tamils to observe three minutes silence on the day Sri Lanka’s civil war ended
title: Mark May 18 as ‘day of grief’, Wigneswaran tells Tamils

author: Meera Srinivasan
description: Says Sri Lanka will leverage its strategic location to become Indian Ocean’s hub
title: Ranil Wickremesinghe hails China’s connectivity project
